body_html: BTW, this paper talks about constraints enforced by Cholesky whitening which are indeed different from square root whitening. The symsqrt version above should be equivalent to matrix square root when the matrix is invertible (it's "ZCA whitening" in the paper)
body_text: BTW, this paper talks about constraints enforced by Cholesky whitening which are indeed different from square root whitening. The symsqrt version above should be equivalent to matrix square root when the matrix is invertible (it's "ZCA whitening" in the paper)
body: BTW, this [paper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1512.00809.pdf) talks about constraints enforced by Cholesky whitening which are indeed different from square root whitening. The `symsqrt` version above should be equivalent to matrix square root when the matrix is invertible (it's "ZCA whitening" in the paper)
